result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Cole Lepak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No appearances.  Hearing held off the Record.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by: ***

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of ONE HUNDRED SEVENTY-TWO (172) DAYS, with credit for ONE HUNDRED SEVENTY-TWO (172) DAYS time served.  CONCURRENT TO SHEBOYGAN COUNTY CASE(S) 15CM109 and 14CM1056.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 03-08-2017or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs UNLESS ALREADY COMPLETED.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Review hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Daniel Cole Lepak not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant's probation was REVOKED from a matter in Sheboygan County.  State moved to REVOKE the agreement.  Court takes that motion under advisement at this time. On motion of the State,  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State requests that matter be adjourned for FORTY-FIVE (45) to SIXTY (60) DAYS to ensure compliance.  Defense does NOT object.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(from) Probation/Parole Agent Adam Kramer.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Daniel Cole Lepak not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.   Court reviewed report from agent.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from agent, received and filed.  cmt

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Daniel Cole Lepak not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

NO FILE IN COURT.  Court vacates the TOT the JPS.
Signed and Filed, No Gun or Drug Order.

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date. Case adjourned to branch 33 for a Review Hearing. 
  Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Daniel Cole Lepak not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
